_ConvolutionHelper

class bosk.block.zoo.multi_grained_scanning._convolution_helpers._PoolingIndices#

Bases: NamedTuple

xs_shape#

Input shape.

full_index_tuple#

Tuple of indices of each pixel for each group (corner position).

n_corners#

Number of corners.

n_kernel_points#

Number of points inside kernel.

pooled_shape#

Pooling result shape (excluding the n_sample dimension).

class bosk.block.zoo.multi_grained_scanning._convolution_helpers._ConvolutionHelper(params)#
Parameters:

params (_ConvolutionParams) –

check_stride(spatial_dims, kernel_size)#

Check the stride and return a correct stride tuple.

Parameters:

  • spatial_dims (Tuple[int, Ellipsis]) – Spatial dimensions.

  • kernel_size (Tuple[int, Ellipsis]) – Kernel dimensions.

Returns:

Stride tuple.

Return type:

Tuple[int, Ellipsis]

get_pooled_shape(spatial_dims, kernel_size, stride)#
Parameters:

  • spatial_dims (Tuple[int, Ellipsis]) –

  • kernel_size (Tuple[int, Ellipsis]) –

  • stride (Tuple[int, Ellipsis]) –

Return type:

Tuple[int, Ellipsis]

prepare_corner(spatial_dims, kernel_size)#

Prepare sliding window corner ids.

Parameters:

  • spatial_dims (Tuple[int, Ellipsis]) – Spatial dimensions.

  • kernel_size (Tuple[int, Ellipsis]) – Kernel dimensions.

Returns:

Sliding window corner indices.

check_kernel_size(n_spatial_dims)#

Check the kernel size and return a correct kernel size tuple.

Parameters:

n_spatial_dims (int) – Number of spatial dimensions.

Returns:

Kernel size tuple.

prepare_kernel(n_spatial_dims)#

Prepare kernel indices.

Parameters:

n_spatial_dims (int) – Number of spatial dimensions.

Returns:

Tuple (kernel size, kernel indices).

pad(xs)#

Add symmetric edge padding to the input array.

Parameters:

xs (numpy.ndarray) – Input data.

Returns:

Padded input.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

prepare_pooling_indices(xs_shape)#

Prepare pooling indices using convolution parameters and the input shape.

Parameters:

xs_shape (Tuple[int, Ellipsis]) – Input shape.

Returns:

Pooling indices.

slice(xs, pooling_indices)#

Cut or slice the data into pieces.

Parameters:

  • xs (numpy.ndarray) – Input n-dimensional data of shape (N, C, F1, …, Fk), where N is the number of samples, C is the number of channels, F1, …, Fk are the spatial dimensions.

  • pooling_indices (_PoolingIndices) –

Returns:

Tuple (sliced data, number of slices).

Return type:

Tuple[numpy.ndarray, int]
